attributes.action: Bring back A-level resits!
attributes.background: We want to bring back A-level resits for alll students across the UK. We want to be able to make sure you can resit your AS year and/or A2 year. It will enable students to have access to a second opportunity and allow them to attend University instead of missing out on the chance to prevail in life.
attributes.additional_details: By bringing back the AS/A2 resits, students will have the opportunity to achieve their highest aspirations in life instead of being set back due to one bad grade.

attributes.action: Rename the RRS Sir David Attenborough to RRS Boaty McBoatface
attributes.background: Britain is known worldwide for both it's excellent scientific research and sense of humour. NERC should accept the choice of RRS Boaty McBoatface (124,109 votes), rather than for RRS Sir David Attenborough (10,284 votes) and respect the true democratic result and excellent British wit.

attributes.action: To Issue National Identity Cards for everyone to protect our National Security.
attributes.background: With the ongoing threat to our borders and security, it is time to introduce a National Identity Card. This must be issued to all UK citizens and to all successful immigration applicants and should be carried at all times. This is a necessary step forward assist our Police and Immigration services.
attributes.additional_details: The refusal of the Government and the opposition of those who defend their privacy, are undermining the security and safety of the majority of people who wish to protect the UK and have nothing to hide!

attributes.action: Bring back national service for school leavers who do not wish to further educat
attributes.background: It would be good for national service to be brought back as it would help lower unemployment help to teach new skills giving them a good start to there working life also it would meen if more people are in work more money will be getting spent in shops ect

attributes.action: Require the Department of Health to review outdated (1988) Child Growth Chart
attributes.background: Infants and Children's weight in the UK is measured on an outdated growth chart formulated in 1988 based on formula fed babies and children in 1988. This is wrongly leading to children and babies being "labelled" as obese from birth.
attributes.additional_details:
I am calling for this petition as today my health visitor advised me that my child who was born just above the 75th centile for weight and above the 98th centile for height is "overweight".  (Despite being breastfed on demand for 16 months of his life, as per best advice to breastfeed for the first year.)
Despite this the Health Visitor tells me that at any contact with a health professional we are likely to be advised about regulating his weight.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory at all schools to have a time dedicated for napping.
attributes.background: A recent NASA study revealed that a 20 minute nap boosted cognition by almost 40%. Therefore in order for a students to fully focus throughout their school day the government should urge schools to set apart a time of day for sleep. Schools could provide dark rooms or pods for sleep only.

attributes.action: Make pet shops pass a test before selling their animals
attributes.background: Many pet shops are giving the wrong advice about their animals, especially exotics, to first time owners and unfortunately they don't know it could be harming their pet. Pet shops should pass a test on each animal they sell to prevent this from happening.
attributes.additional_details:
The main issues are:
The wrong food 
Incorrect housing size/type
Incorrect size/type wheels (wire ones injure feet)
Telling people solitary animals "need a friend"
Incorrect bedding type (usually sawdust which is avoided by most people)
Failing to tell customers that CAPTIVE BRED ANIMALS SHOULD NOT BE RELEASED INTO THE WILD

attributes.action: Make it law for all horse riders to wear hi-viz clothing when riding on the road
attributes.background:
As a horse rider, nothing infuriates me more than other riders who risk themselves and their horses by hacking on roads not wearing hi-viz. 
We expect drivers and other road users to slow down when passing us so we should make sure we can be seen well in advance.
attributes.additional_details:
Wearing hi-viz increases visibility by seconds. 
By not wearing it riders increase the risk of accident.

Be safe, be seen!

attributes.action: Hold an all-party public inquiry into bullying and harassment in Parliament
attributes.background:
Recent difficulties in relations between MP's in the Labour Party have highlighted an endemic culture of bullying within HoC.

Bullying & harassment aren't accepted in any other workplace or institution in the UK. This toxic culture is harming individuals and politics more widely.
attributes.additional_details:
MP reduced to tears watching personal attacks at Labour leader designed to "Break him as a man": http://tinyurl.com/zl268n5

Some of these MPs have since stated they felt extreme pressure to vote "no confidence" in the leader

Conservative MPs have spoken out against bullying behaviour and how ineffective current anti-bullying measures are: http://tinyurl.com/z8se6nz

We need

* Full inquiry into bullying into HoC
* Measures to bring protection for MPs and HoC staff in line with other workplaces

attributes.action: Waive all fees for EU citizens applying for permanent residency or citizenship
attributes.background: The outcome of the EU referendum means that many EU citizens will be liable for fees amounting to several thousand pounds in order to secure their right to stay in the country.  It would be a great injustice given that they had no right to vote in this referendum.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory in elections and referendums, similar to Australian law.
attributes.background: Voters are obliged to vote in elections or attend a poling station, or log a postal vote, if they do not they could be subject to a penalty, such as fines or community service. Currently there are 22 countries, including Australia, that have this system.

attributes.action: an amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow Pound and Ounces.
attributes.background:
We the undersigned would like to be able to buy and sell goods in Pounds and Ounces. All it would take is a small amendment to the Weights and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to buy and sell goods in Pound and Ounces.  



This is a Zider Party campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
To sell goods in pounds and ounces was made illegally by the weights and measures Act 1985.

All we ask is for a small amendment to the Weight and Measures Act 1985 to allow us to use pounds and ounces to buy and sells goods.

attributes.action: Change the law to make the result of referendums in the UK legally binding.
attributes.background: Referendums held in the UK are not currently legally enforceable and parliament is under no duty to enact their results. MPs are elecred by the will of the people to represent the people, as such they must comply democratically with the demands of the people.
attributes.additional_details: From time to time UK Governments hold referendums. Regardless of the outcome, the government is under no legal obligation to accept the outcome. This is entirely undemocratic and must change.

attributes.action: All Public & Committee meetings in Council & Government should be Live-Streamed
attributes.background: To further the interests of transparency and openness, a presumption should be made to Live-Stream all meetings that affect people's lives, so no official or elected representative can hide behind anonymity and we, as citizens, will no longer be deceived or have communications  "spun".
attributes.additional_details: Where there is no risk of compromise to individuals or families, the presumption must be that all public or committee meetings should be live-streamed so citizens have less reason to distrust politicians or civil servants. If there is nothing to hide, there is nothing to fear is what we are told by government agencies concerned with surveillance and monitoring, so the same should apply to government. The United Kingdom should be a world leader in "glasnost" not forever in the shadows.

attributes.action: Provides refuge in the UK for our armed forces interpreters in all war zones
attributes.background: I served for 30 years in the RAF, I completed my service for my country in 2005. To read that the country I served for, is hanging out to dry, even signing the death warrant of those brave local people, and their families who assisted our personnel in recent war zones deeply upsets me.
attributes.additional_details:
Trade                    Aircraft Avionics
Rank                     Chief Technician
Last Posting         RAF Cosford

attributes.action: Make Climate Change education a compulsory aspect of the UK national curriculum.
attributes.background: Climate change is arguably the most complex problem ever faced by humanity and the consequences of inaction will be most felt by our children. The fact that this information is not delivered in our schools with urgency is unacceptable and we are letting all future generations down!
attributes.additional_details:
How can we expect to encourage global collaboration and eco-innovation in the UK's future if our children are not even aware of this serious problem? Human induced climate change cannot be ignored any more. We are letting our children/country/planet down by not encouraging active debate on this issue in our schools. 
Current curricula: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/national-curriculum. 
IPCC Climate Report: http://ipccwg2.gov/AR5/images/uploads/WG2AR5_SPM_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Make the parent receiving child maintenance provide receipts to remain eligible
attributes.background: Fathers and Mothers paying child maintenance should have proof that the money is being spent on their child/children and not funding the receiving parents social life or any other activities that do not directly benefit the children involved.
attributes.additional_details: My own personal case has seen me paying child maintenance for 4 years and I am yet to see any benefit it has had for my children. If by law the receiving parent had to provide receipts to show that the money received had been spent on the children and not on themselves then the majority of children in child maintenance cases would be better off as they would get 100% of the money spent on them.

attributes.action: Ensure road cyclists pay a tax and adhere to a DVLA type set of rules
attributes.background:
Taxing cyclists who are over the age of 18 £30 a year would generate £130m+ per year which can be used for cycle lane projects and improving the roads.

With this tax, cyclists should also be made to followe a DVLA type set of rules when on the roads.
attributes.additional_details:
The tax would generate over £130m+ a year which could be used to improve roads for cyclalcists and help with cycle lane projects.

The DVLA type rules would also help reduce the amount of road accidents involving cyclists. Currently 48% of all cyclists feel unsafe when out on the roads. These new rules will help both cyclists and other road users make better choices when it comes to scenarios involving cyclists.

Do the right thing for Britain - sign this petition.

attributes.action: Establish economic tests to assess readiness for Brexit.
attributes.background: The decision to leave the European Union will have huge consequences for the United Kingdom. The economic tests that were created to assess readiness for EMU provide a model for taking proper account of the economic consequences prior to notifying the EU of our intention to leave under Article 50.
attributes.additional_details: Various attempts have been made to estimate the cost to the UK of Brexit. Such an estimate has to take into account potential loss of trade, inward investment and joint R&D, as well as additional spending on the military, borders, redundancy and pensions, and bureaucracy. This is against the background of record debt (approx. 90% GDP). Parliament should establish metrics for the economic impact of each Brexit scenario (e.g. so-called hard or soft) so that an informed decision can be made.

attributes.action: Stop the production of the 1 pence coins.
attributes.background:
The rate of inflation has made 1 pence coins virtually unusable. 
Canada has already removed its lowest value currency from circulation.
If the cost to produce one Canadian Penny is 1.5 Canadian Cents, then we can assume it has a similar cost in the UK.
It is uneconomical to keep in circulation.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/cost_to_produce_one_penny

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-21292441

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for recreational use by over 16s
attributes.background: Cannabis has been a Class B drug in the UK since 2009, meaning that it's illegal to sell, distribute, or use the drug in any way. However, millions of people throughout the UK still take advantage of cannabis for their recreational use, often turning to backstreet dealers who are making thousands.
attributes.additional_details:
If cannabis was commercially available in UK pharmacies & supermarkets, not only would British businesses profit massively, but the VAT attached would make millions of pounds for the UK economy, which could be spent on things such as a better-funded NHS & more modern facilities for our schools. 

Cannabis has often been branded as bad for one's health, when in reality, it often soothes anxiety; prevents glaucoma; and doesn't have a harmful effect on your organs like tobacco & alcohol can.

attributes.action: Ban Fixed Odds Betting Terminals
attributes.background:
Following the Gambling Act of 2005, Fixed Odds Betting Terminals are a feature in bookmakers' shops on our high streets.
Government should  give Councils powers to ban them from the high street
attributes.additional_details:
FOBTs are called the "crack cocaine" of gambling.
Users can lose hundreds of pounds in only a few minutes and can turn violent when this happens.
FOBTs destroy lives and families.
Government should act to ban them from our high streets.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to direct hatred and abuse at any societal groups.
attributes.background: Racism and xenophobia have been legitimised in post-Brexit campaign Britain. We need to prevent extremist politicians, pressure groups and newspapers from inciting the hatred that has led to children being called 'vermin' and told to 'go home', and offensive slogans appearing in our cities.
attributes.additional_details: We would like Parliament to pass legislation making it illegal to target ANY group of people with hate messages, whether spoken, written or pictorial, so that politicians, pressure groups and newspapers can no longer use sensationalist headlines that scapegoat specific groups in society and make them a target for racism, xenophobia and other forms of hatred and abuse.

attributes.action: Make it offence to film members of the emergency service for negative propaganda
attributes.background: There has been a recent increase in the number of cases via media channels (Facebook, YouTube) by members of the public recording Emergency Services, NHS and HM forces personnel, whilst causing harassment to provoke a reaction so the footage can be uploaded and used a negative propaganda.
attributes.additional_details: Propaganda is defined by Nelson (1996) as "a systematic form of purposeful persuasion that attempts to influence the emotions, attitudes, opinions, and actions of specified target audiences for ideological, political or commercial purposes through the controlled transmission of one-sided messages (which may or may not be factual) via mass and direct media channels.

attributes.action: Ban politicians from office who lie or deliberately/knowingly deceive the public
attributes.background: Recently there has been considerable deception on the part of politicians who appear to have deliberately deceived the British public on matters affecting the future well-being of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: A politician shown to have seriously lied or deliberately or knowingly deceived the public on important matters of national interest should be barred from holding any ministerial post in government.

attributes.action: Increase standard benefit amount for ESA, & improve screening process for PIP.
attributes.background:
Thousands of people are too scared to apply for benefits, due to fear of losing current benefits or being taken to court 

The amount for ESA is £57 per week. PIP is awarded if you qualify at a testing centre, where 'not looking tired enough' will get your application declined.
attributes.additional_details:
I am part of a fibromyalgia support page, and a bipolar support page. Both of these pages are full of people who are applying for PIP and ESA, and being turned down due to 'not looking tired enough' (fibromyalgia sufferer), 'being able to be woken up by strangers at their stop on a bus' (narcolepsy sufferer), 'being mobile' when the person has to use an electric wheelchair paid for by themselves due to benefit refusal (fibromyalgia sufferer) 

Austerity is being applied in the wrong places.

attributes.action: Change the law all assets to be sold/split equally when a relationship ends.
attributes.background: Current law allows the parent remaining with the kids to remain in the family home till the youngest turns 18. Leaving the other parent potentially homeless. The law needs to change so that the when separation/divorce happens all assets should be sold/divided equally allowing both to move on
attributes.additional_details: I am currently living with family as I can not afford nor get help with housing. I share my kids so when I have them I rely on family to put me and my kids up. This is extremely unfair on all. I am not the first nor will I be the last to find myself in this situation. Most people will know of someone having the same issue as myself. Mediation/solicitors/court costs if the law was changed so that when a couple separate/divorce all assets should be sold/divided equally it would save time and money

attributes.action: Issue a two-year flight ban for travelers who cause disruption on airplanes
attributes.background: Airplane security is essential not only when combatting terrorism but for travelers to feel generally safe and ensure there are no added risks to flying. Recently, poor or drunken behaviour by some travelers has caused distress and has even required planes to be diverted.
attributes.additional_details: Increasingly there are stories of drunken and rowdy passengers causing problems on flights in and around Europe. Unfortunately, many of these are British travelers. At a time when airline safety is critical, this unwanted behaviour is creating added pressure and fining the travelers is often not a strong enough sanction. A two-year flight ban would hopefully be a more suitable sanction and also act as a deterrent.

attributes.action: All plastic packaging produced by supermarkets must be made to be recyclable
attributes.background: There is an inordinate amount of plastic produced by supermarkets.  At least 50% of this shows that it is not recyclable. So much plastic is being put into bins and then into landfill. Individuals are responsible for recycling but given the opportunity to recycle more I think most will.

attributes.action: In a 2nd independence referendum, Scots living outside Scotland will get a vote
attributes.background: The recent referendum on EU membership may now precipitate a 2nd Scottish independence referendum.  If the Scottish Government takes this step, then it is reasonable that Scottish-born people currently living outside of Scotland have a vote in such a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Scottish-born people, whether they are currently living in England or elsewhere, will be affected by the result of such a referendum, as it will have serious and life-changing implications for their future choice of nationality, citizenship and passport etc., both for themselves and for their descendants.

attributes.action: Refuse admission of Mr Donald Trump to any crown property.
attributes.background: Mr Donald Trump, the property developer, plans to visit the UK. In response to his racist comments, this petition acknowledges his right to travel here but calls on the UK government not to permit him to set foot on crown property such as the Palace of Westminster or 10 Downing Street.
attributes.additional_details:
Republican and Democrat nominees have previously visited London ahead of US elections and been welcomed by successive governments.
In a campaign statement, Mr Trump advocated a "total and complete shutdown of Muslims entering the United States", a proposal the White House said was contrary to US values and its national security interests.
In his candidacy announcement Trump referred to Mexican immigrants to the US as rapists. 
He should not be afforded a platform in the halls of UK democracy.

attributes.action: The new British Ajax armoured fighting vehicles ALL to be built in the UK.
attributes.background: In a time when British industry, particularly the steel industry, is in crisis, it is abhorrent to patriotic British people that equipment intended for use by our service personnel is being built outside of our country and using materials that have not been supplied from our country

attributes.action: Stop forced adoption. It's destroying families, our children are not your profit
attributes.background: We need a full investigation on how SS work taking children from their mum when no acutal harm has come to their child, however they say that there 'could be potential harm'. It costs more to adopt out then to keep the baby with the mother, something needs to be done, our children are at risk.
attributes.additional_details: forced adoption happens in secret family courts, a council are given a target to meet on how many babies/children they need to adopt to get bonuses. John hemming, a known mp who knows all about this matter and sees the doings. Understandingly I know ss have the duty of care to a child I don't disputes that but ever since baby p (bless hes soul) mothers that wouldn't put their babies at harm are paying the price or living the consequences of how you had a bad up bringing

attributes.action: The UK Government to stop wild animal fur imports and skins into the UK.
attributes.background: Wild animals (such as leopards, tiger, crocodiles, turtles, bears and giant otters) are killed for their skin and fur to make profit.  Their skins are used for unnecessary items such as clothing, shoes, handbags and accessories. We want this to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of young people who are passionate about wild animals and want to stop poachers.  We had a visit recently from the Schools' Education Officer from the UK Parlimentary Office.  Previously, we have organised animal rescue club and raised money for the WWF.

attributes.action: A constitution that forbids our Parliament ceding sovereignty to foreign powers.
attributes.background: This would prevent governments gradually ceding sovereignty to foreign powers as they have done for example over the last 44 years to the EU treaty by treaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Tony Benn on the Lisbon treaty & the EU > https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GTjg-vt0Ao4

'If parliament transfers sovereignty away in treaties such as Lisbon then it is stealing rights that don't belong to it because an MP is lent powers of the public for 5 years

But if in those 5 years you give it away to somebody else then you can't repeal those laws. This is a theft of public rights.'

attributes.action: All businesses to have disabled access including a ramp and moving space inside.
attributes.background: A lot of small businesses don't have disabled access, preventing people (like my mother who was diagnosed with rheumatoid and osteoarthritis a few years back) entering shops. Some that do have a ramp to allow the disabled into the store don't have enough space to allow navigation around the store.
attributes.additional_details: Please help make it illegal for shops to not have disabled access (a ramp and enough space inside) as this prevents people, like my mother, entering shops whatsoever.

attributes.action: Urge India to end abuse Human Rights abuse and initiate a peaceful dialogue
attributes.background:
Recent use of pellet guns on Kashmiri protestors has caused blindness of more than 150 people mostly children and 60 deaths.
Kashmir is under curfew and serious restrictions imposed on normal daily life for 45 days.
Indian refuses to initiate a dialogue
attributes.additional_details:
1. Sir Henry Harding, Governor General on behalf of the British sold Kashmir in 1846 to the Maharaja of Punjab Gulab Singh for 7,500,000 Indian Rupees who then gave it away as a dowry to his son in law Maharaja Hari Singh!
2. British citizensof Kashmiri origin have relatives, near and dear one suffering from the atrocities
3. Kashmir issue is the main flash point between the two nuclear powers, India and Pakistan. Violence only breads violence and plays in the hands of foreign agencies.

attributes.action: Raise awareness and increase funding for Mental Health.
attributes.background: Mental Health is a significant issue in the UK. Around 25% of all UK citizens experience mental illness, and almost a third of children in education will experience it. It is a silent issue that many feel embarrassed to discuss. Our aim is to raise support for those who experience mental illness.
attributes.additional_details: We (National Citizen Service) are currently aiming to work in association with a charity called 'Mind' who are currently supporting around 375,000 people, which is drastically less than the 25% that come forward regarding their mental illness.

attributes.action: Compulsory dyslexia tests in schools
attributes.background: At the moment there aren't compulsory tests for dyslexia in primary schools so thousands of children struggle through their school life without knowing that they have it. This needs to change so that they can receive support and advice to help them.

attributes.action: Increase payment for Early Years Education Funding
attributes.background: As a self funded Pre School and with the rising wage costs along with upcoming work pensions we along with many other pre schools are finding sustainably impossible. Funding that we rely on has not increased to cover these costs. We fear closure leading to no places for children in the future.
attributes.additional_details: We have to have a certain amount of staff per group of children who all need to be paid at least the minimum wage. We are self funded. Incoming money funds staff costs, rent, phone, equipment & resources, HMRC, Ofsted, insurances, food etc. Cash flow forecasts shows we will not be able to sustain provision in the near future if funding is not increased, leaving children without a place and parents without childcare & staff without an income.

attributes.action: Qualify MA (LPC with Business) for Postgraduate Student Finance funding.
attributes.background: Student Finance has recently announced that from 1 August 2016 it will be possible to apply for up to £10,000 funding to pay for the course and the living expenses.  Currently this does not include the Legal Practice Course with integrated  Masters.
attributes.additional_details: Students who cannot afford to pay for the course themselves do have the opportunity to complete their Legal Practice course. If Student Finance is available for Masters, then it should also be available for the other postgraduate courses which include Masters qualification.

attributes.action: The EU flag be flown from parliament on alternate days with the Union Flag.
attributes.background: This petition grows out of national frustration with the referendum, and at how various governments, over the decades, have failed to promote the benefits of the EU to the public at large.
attributes.additional_details:
Flags are matters of high symbolic importance. In most EU member states, the EU flag is routinely flown alongside the national flag. This practice should have been instituted in the UK long ago. 
The most prominent flagstaff in the land is that on Parliament itself. For practical reasons it may not be possible to hoist two, thus the proposal is for flying the UK and EU flags on alternate days.

attributes.action: Stop making cuts to the NHS mental health service.
attributes.background:
More people have started suffering from mental health issues.
The majority are desperate for help, but when they reach out there is nothing there.
Suicide rates are increasing due to thinking there is no hope.
If the NHS keeps cutting funding for mental health support this will just get worse.

attributes.action: Instate the death penalty for all paedophiles.
attributes.background: The European Convention of Human Rights has interfered with the rights of British children to be protected from the most depraved individuals infesting our society. The death penalty should be instated against all pedophiles, as the ultimate deterrent and the ultimate protection for our children.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophilia, parallels genocide as one of the most vile acts committed against the most vulnerable. It is our duty to protect children from all levels of harm. The present legal system of a few years to life in prison for pedophiles, fails completely to protect children. The soft penalty of prison, does nothing to deter offenders and entices paedophiles released from prison to offend again, and again and again. Hanging paedophiles will make them think twice before harming children.

attributes.action: Introduce a new written UK Constitution
attributes.background: In the wake of the UK's imminent exit from the EU, we need a written Constitution at this time of uncertainty to shape the relationship between the citizens and the state. We need a written Constitution that reflects the values of a modern society that is tolerant, pluralistic and multicultural.
attributes.additional_details: The immediate legal consequences of leaving the EU are far-reaching and uncertain for fundamental rights of UK citizens. We need a set of ground rules that we understand and which respect our fundamental rights and freedoms in matters of employment law, property, housing, healthcare, education, children and access to courts. The drafting of a new UK Constitution should not be delayed.

attributes.action: Include Feminism as part of the primary and/or secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: As a female sixth form student, I have come across few male peers who fully understand feminism. Many refuse to accept that gender inequality is still an issue both nationally and globally, and see feminists as man-hating groups advocating female superiority. This ignorance must be addressed.
attributes.additional_details: If people were made aware and given a full understanding of Feminism and gender inequality from a young age, they would be far more tuned in to these issues in adult life. This would be effective in helping society to become more equal and tolerant in terms of gender, which would benefit everyone, including men. The main factor inhibiting the achievement of gender equality appears to be a general ignorance of the fact that inequality exists. The way to address this ignorance is education.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke in front of children, or in rooms which they use
attributes.background: Adults who smoke in front of children, especially inside a house are neglecting the health of that child. Smoke also hangs around on furniture / walls / curtains, making it an unhealthy environment for the child. Smoking in front of a child should be illegal and deemed as child neglect

attributes.action: Allow U.K. expatriates to vote in the E.U. referendum
attributes.background:
Current law prevents expatriates who have been 'ordinarily non resident' - as defined by HMRC - from voting in any U.K. election.
This inspite of the fact that a vast majority are expatriates due to employment, family or health reasons. They are also required to submit U.K. tax returns.
attributes.additional_details: Incarcerated criminals are currently denied the vote in the U.K. Are expats classed as criminals?

attributes.action: Instruct Royal Mail to change its opt-out scheme for junk mail to an opt-in one.
attributes.background: Royal Mail earns over £1.3 bn each year from junk mail deliveries. (It calls it "unaddressed mail"). It offers an opt-out service, but this does not work. An opt-in system would ensure that only those who wish to receive junk mail receive it.
attributes.additional_details: The opt-out system does not work: there is no confirmation of a successful application to opt-out; the opt-out only lasts for two years; there is no notification of the end date; and there is no invitation to renew the opt-out at the end of the two year period. In spite of all the hurdles put in place by Royal Mail, junk mail still gets delivered. The system in place does not work, so it needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Change the house buying process in England, Wales and NI
attributes.background: A petition to address the requirement of consumer protection when purchasing or selling a property. Minimising financial exposure and risk after price agreement and the subsequent common terms of sale changes; gazumping, gazundering and pulling out. MPs to create safeguards in earlier commitment.
